intro: Stenanthemum patens, commonly known as the spreading stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its natural habitat. Stenanthemum patens is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
